decks.notes: The main goal of this deck is to use the card Doomsday to set up a winning combination of cards that will allow the player to win the game in one turn. The deck contains a variety of card draw spells and tutors to help assemble the necessary pieces, along with countermagic to protect the combo. The key concept of this deck is to efficiently and quickly assemble the Doomsday combo and execute it to secure a victory before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to create a combo with Brain Freeze to mill the opponent's library. It includes powerful spells like Force of Will, Dack Fayden, and Pyroblast for control, along with cantrips like Preordain and Ponder for card selection. The deck also includes mana fixing cards like Polluted Delta and Misty Rainforest, along with fast mana like Black Lotus and Lion's Eye Diamond to power out its combo quickly. Additional interaction and card advantage cards like Demonic Tutor, Ancestral Recall, and Narset, Parter of Veils round out the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic and removal spells, while utilizing the powerful Oath of Druids to cheat out big threats like Griselbrand and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. The deck also includes disruptive planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Narset, Parter of Veils to further control the battlefield. The inclusion of efficient spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast ensures the deck can easily handle threats while also digging for key cards with cards like Dig Through Time and Preordain.

The deck aims to combo off quickly using powerful artifacts and mana acceleration to generate a large amount of mana. The goal is to cast Paradoxical Outcome to draw a massive amount of cards while also replaying key artifacts for more mana and card advantage. The deck includes powerful disruption spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo, as well as cards like Narset, Parter of Veils to lock opponents out of drawing more cards. The deck seeks to win the game quickly through overwhelming card advantage and mana resources.

This deck is focused on using efficient spells and powerful planeswalkers to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly closing out the game with aggressive creatures. It takes advantage of powerful blue cantrips and card draw spells to find key cards like Time Walk and Underworld Breach. With a mix of countermagic, removal, and versatile threats like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage, it aims to apply pressure while maintaining tempo advantage over the opponent. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of spells and ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill the battlefield with powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba. The deck focuses on dredging cards from the library into the graveyard, enabling cards like Dread Return and Cabal Therapy to be used effectively. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of powerful creatures and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively get creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Once Upon a Time to dig for key pieces. The deck aims to play cards for free, such as Hollow One and Vengevine, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to control the game. By combining card advantage and fast creature deployment, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly through aggressive plays and efficient use of resources.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to control the board and lock down opponent's options. It capitalizes on powerful mana acceleration such as Black Lotus and Mana Vault to quickly establish a strong board presence. The deck also includes powerful control spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its key pieces. Urza, Lord High Artificer and Sai, Master Thopterist generate additional value from artifacts, while Karn, the Great Creator disrupts opponent's strategy by shutting down artifacts. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through efficient resource management and overwhelming board presence.

The deck aims to play aggressively and efficiently by using powerful spells and card advantage to control the game. By utilizing cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, the deck can draw through the library quickly and gain extra turns to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own. The deck also benefits from synergy between its powerful creatures and spells, allowing for a versatile and adaptable playstyle.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and efficient control spells to maintain board advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Oko, Narset, and Dack Fayden alongside powerful permission spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of mana denial cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine, along with versatile threats like Dreadhorde Arcanist, provides the deck with multiple angles of attack to secure victory in the Vintage format.

This Vintage aggro MUD deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by deploying various taxing artifacts like Sphere of Resistance, Trinisphere, and Thorn of Amethyst. It also utilizes powerful artifacts such as Karn, the Great Creator and Sundering Titan to control the board and generate advantage. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while deploying threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem to pressure them. The inclusion of land destruction elements like Wasteland and Strip Mine further empowers the deck's ability to control the game and secure a win.

The main focus of this Aggro-MUD Vintage 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient artifact creatures like Walking Ballista, Traxos, Scourge of Kroog, and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck utilizes mana acceleration from Mishra's Workshop and mana artifacts to play disruptive pieces like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere to hinder opponents' game plans. With the ability to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies, while applying pressure with efficient threats, this deck aims to overpower opponents and win the game before they can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game while applying pressure to the opponent through aggressive plays and card advantage. By utilizing efficient removal spells and counterspells like Swords to Plowshares, Pyroblast, and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while protecting its own threats. Cards like Young Pyromancer and Monastery Mentor generate additional value from casting spells, while card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time help maintain momentum. Overall, the deck seeks to outmaneuver the opponent with a combination of tempo plays and card advantage.

The focus of this deck is to utilize graveyard mechanics and self-mill effects to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Cabal Therapy and Dread Return, the deck can quickly bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The goal is to create a strong board presence while also having the ability to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Will and Unmask. By efficiently utilizing the graveyard, the deck aims to create a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes powerful cards like Wasteland and Force of Will to control the game, along with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Leovold. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Assassin's Trophy and Collector Ouphe to hinder the opponent?s game plan. By combining disruption with aggression, this deck aims to outplay the opponent and secure victory through a combination of resource denial and efficient creature attacks.

This deck focuses on a combination of powerful spells, card advantage, and tempo plays to disrupt the opponent while applying aggressive pressure. By utilizing cards like Pyroblast, Force of Will, and Dreadhorde Arcanist, the deck aims to control the game and generate incremental advantages. The inclusion of Jeskai colors allows for a versatile range of answers and threats, while also enabling efficient mana usage through cantrips and fast mana rocks. Overall, the deck seeks to establish dominance early on and maintain control throughout the game.
